org.sakaiproject.email.api

Interface EmailService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicEmailService

    public interface EmailService

    EmailService is an interface to sending emails.

    • Method Detail

      • sendMail

        void sendMail(javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress from,
            javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress[] to,
            String subject,
            String content,
            javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress[] headerTo,
            javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress[] replyTo,
            List<String> additionalHeaders)
        Creates and sends a generic text MIME message to the address contained in to.
        Parameters:
        from - The address this message is to be listed as coming from.
        to - The address(es) this message should be sent to.
        subject - The subject of this message.
        content - The body of the message.
        headerTo - If specified, this is placed into the message header, but "to" is used for the recipients.
        replyTo - If specified, this is the reply to header address(es).
        additionalHeaders - Additional email headers to send (List of String). For example, content type or forwarded headers (may be null)

      • sendMail

        void sendMail(javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress from,
            javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress[] to,
            String subject,
            String content,
            Map<EmailAddress.RecipientType,javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress[]> headerTo,
            javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress[] replyTo,
            List<String> additionalHeaders,
            List<Attachment> attachments)

        Creates and sends a generic text MIME message to the address contained in to.

        Some character set constants are available in CharacterSet
        The content type should be of the format "text/plain; charset=windows-1252; format=flowed"

        Parameters:
        from - The address this message is to be listed as coming from.
        to - The address(es) this message should be sent to. These addresses are used in the SMTP routing.
        subject - The subject of this message.
        content - The body of the message.
        headerTo - If specified, this is placed into the message header, but "to" is used for the actual recipients.
        replyTo - If specified, the reply-to header value.
        additionalHeaders - Additional email headers to send (List of String). For example, content type or forwarded headers (may be null)
        attachments -

      • send

        void send(String fromStr,
        String toStr,
        String subject,
        String content,
        String headerToStr,
        String replyToStr,
        List<String> additionalHeaders)
        Creates and sends a generic text MIME message to the address contained in to.
        Parameters:
        fromStr - The address this message is to be listed as coming from.
        toStr - The address(es) this message should be sent to.
        subject - The subject of this message.
        content - The body of the message.
        headerToStr - If specified, this is placed into the message header, but "too" is used for the recipients.
        replyToStr - If specified, the reply-to header value.
        additionalHeaders - Additional email headers to send (List of String). For example, content type or forwarded headers (may be null)

      • sendToUsers

        void sendToUsers(Collection<User> users,
               Collection<String> headers,
               String message)
        Send a single message to a set of Users.
        Parameters:
        users - Collection (of User) to send the message to (for those with valid email addresses).
        headers - List (of String, form "name: value") of headers for the message.
        message - String body of the message.

      • send

        List<EmailAddress> send(EmailMessage message)
                        throws AddressValidationException,
                               NoRecipientsException
        Sends a single message to a set of users.
        Parameters:
        message - EmailMessage that contains the parameters to create a message to the specified recipients.
        Returns:
        List of recipients that were found to be invalid per to InternetAddress.
        Throws:
        AddressValidationException - If any recipient addresses are found to be invalid. This is checked when converting to InternetAddress.
        NoRecipientsException
